source_caption_data.pre_caption: This is a time-lapse video of a dramatic storm developing over a vast, open field. The dark, heavy clouds are seen rapidly swirling and rolling across the sky. Rain can be seen falling in the distance as the storm system moves over the landscape.
source_caption_data.pre_caption_prompt: The video is a scenery shot. You do not need to describe the subject motion. Just note that briefly in one to three sentences.
source_caption_data.final_caption: This is a time-lapse video of a dramatic storm developing over a vast, open field. The dark, heavy clouds are seen rapidly swirling and rolling across the sky. Rain can be seen falling in the distance as the storm system moves over the landscape.

generated_critique: The caption accurately describes the motion of the clouds and rain. However, it includes the subjective adjective "dramatic," which should be removed. Additionally, the first sentence, "This is a time-lapse video of a dramatic storm developing over a vast, open field," is introductory and should be omitted to focus solely on the description of motion as instructed. The description can be made more concise by directly describing the movement. A better version would be: "In this time-lapse, dark clouds rapidly swirl and roll across the sky above an open field, while a sheet of rain is visible falling and moving across the landscape in the distance."
revised_caption_by_generated_critique: In this time-lapse, dark clouds rapidly swirl and roll across the sky above an open field, while a sheet of rain is visible falling and moving across the landscape in the distance.
